description.narrative: (Rwanda): Due to high rates of chronic malnutrition in Rwanda, particularly among children under two years of age, USAID will continue its support for the Gikuriro (Well Growing Child) integrated nutrition and water, hygiene and sanitation (WASH) activity. The goal of Gikuriro is to improve the nutritional status of women of reproductive age and children under five years of age, with an emphasis on the 1,000 day window of opportunity from pregnancy until a child's second birthday. Gikuriro promotes WASH activities, including hand washing practices and safe water use to prevent diarrheal diseases that interfere with nutrient absorption among children. With FY 2018 funds, Gikuriro is expected to reach a total of 253,480 children under five years of age and their mothers with nutrition and hygiene interventions, and maternal and child health services at community level. Gikuriro will promote maternal health by counseling pregnant women to attend at least four antenatal care visits at health facilities in five districts. Catholic Relief Services, the implementer of Gikuriro, will continue to apply its technical expertise serving the most vulnerable people especially women and children. A concerted focus on the 1,000 day window is crucial to accomplishing the Country Development Cooperation Strategy (CDCS) goal of improving the health and nutrition status of Rwandans...
